comments:
After updating Eclipse from 2.1.1 to 2.1.2 I can't access to my CVS repository 
in SourceForge with the same configuration:

   CVS_RSH: ssh (neither with plink.exe)
   Parameters: {host} -| {user}
   CVS_SERVER: cvs

And the properties of the Repository are:

   - Use the repository identification string as the label
   - Connection type: extssh
   - User
   - Password

The returned error is:

   :protocol error :Root request missing

zanks
N.

Nothing changed in the CVS plugin between 2.1.1 and 2.1.2. Could you follow 
the steps outlines at the following URL to get a protocol trace of the failed 
operation and append the trace to this bug report?

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-vcm-
home/docs/online/cvs_features2.0/cvs-faq.html#misc_0

I get the same error when I try to connect to sourceforge.
I try to access :extssh:omry_y@cvs.sourceforge.net:kobjects, it accepts my
password, but when it tries to fetch the files listing it gives me the error.
I am using 3.1 M4.

This the exception, in the dialog I get:
: Protocol error: Root request missing


org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSServerException: The server
reported an error while performing the "cvs update" command.
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Request.executeRequest(Request.java:178)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command.doExecute(Command.java:401)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Update.doExecute(Update.java:200)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command$1.run(Command.java:320)
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolder.run(RemoteFolder.java:463)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command.execute(Command.java:332)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Command.execute(Command.java:734)
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderMemberFetcher.performUpdate(RemoteFolderMemberFetcher.java:101)
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.FetchMembersOperation$InternalRemoteFolderMemberFetcher.performUpdate(FetchMembersOperation.java:67)
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderMemberFetcher.fetchMembers(RemoteFolderMemberFetcher.java:61)
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.RemoteFolderMemberFetcher.fetchMembers(RemoteFolderMemberFetcher.java:52)
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.FetchMembersOperation.execute(FetchMembersOperation.java:105)
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.operations.CVSOperation.run(CVSOperation.java:87)
at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.model.CVSTagElement.fetchDeferredChildren(CVSTagElement.java:133)
at
org.eclipse.ui.progress.DeferredTreeContentManager$1.run(DeferredTreeContentManager.java:168)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

figured it out, the problem was I used kobjects as the repository path, instead of 
/cvsroot/kobjects.
the error is somewhat misleading.
something like "invalid repostory path : kobjects" would save me some time.

traces.message: The server reported an error while performing the "cvs update" command.
